item.title: Portable 7-Zip, ClamAV, Foxit, VideoLAN - ID: 1362916
item.detail:
Dear John,
first of all many thanks for contributing such useful Open Source programs to the community! Therefore I updated and added some program listings at betanews.com for you.
With Portable OpenOffice.org I already can view and edit most document formats on every PC or laptop just by plugging in my USB thumbdrive. I can convert incompatible Word, Excel and Powerpoint files to standard OpenDocument formats and then export them easily into the Portable Document Format (PDF).
But what about four other important file format types: archive, multimedia, PDF and virus files?
Now that Google supports Firefox, Gaim and VideoLAN, these already good alternatives have the power to become standard programs.
With Portable VideoLAN I could take most multimedia files AND a player on my USB thumbdrive and could watch and listen them on every PC. http://planet.videolan.org/ http://www.videolan.org/vlc/
7-Zip is one of the best archive programs, it extracts many archive formats and creates extremely high compressed 7z archives. Even the popular WinRAR supports 7z archives already.
With Portable 7-Zip I could compress everything I need to transport with my USB thumbdrive to very small 7z files and could extract them on every PC. Every week and every new Portable App means less free space on my USB thumbdrive. http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=1280551&forum_id=45797 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/7-zip
ClamAV is a powerful and cross platform anti virus program.
With Portable ClamAV every normal PC user could test every computer he is working with BEFORE he works with it. The first thing he has to do is just plugging in his USB thumbdrive and let Portable ClamAV automatically scan memory, boot sectors and all hard disk files. http://www.bransoft.com/clammail/clammail.html http://www.clamwin.net/ http://www.clamav.net/3rdparty.html#gui
An alternative to ClamAV would be AVG Anti-Virus, but it's only Freeware, not Open Source. It is strongly supported by Intel and has a very good scanning engine. http://www.grisoft.com/doc/314/lng/us/tpl/tpl01
And instead of downloading and installing the 23 MB Adobe Reader when I want to view the standard PDF files generated by Portable OpenOffice.org, it would be much easier just to start the free and small Foxit Reader right from my iPod. http://www.foxitsoftware.com/pdf/rd_intro.php This program is Freeware, too.
I could convince all people of these great programs without forcing them to install anything onto their computers. Just by plugging my thumbdrive in and showing them the power of Open Source.
Best regards, Ren¨¦

item.title: Apps that run on multiple platforms - ID: 2943252
item.detail:
Hello,
I'm the admin of DocFetcher, a desktop-search app written in Java, which is hosted on SourceForge.net as well. Currently, we have a portable version which is capable of running on both Windows and Linux, provided that a Java Runtime is installed. On Windows, the program is launched with an Exe, on Linux with a shell script.
We'd like to make this portable version Portable Apps compatible. However, after having skimmed your docs, I have the impression that Portable Apps are generally Windows-only. Is this correct? And if so, are there any plans to support programs that run on multiple platforms, especially Java programs?
Best regards q:-) <= Tran Nam Quang

item.title: Media Player Classic - ID: 3173343
item.detail: add media player classic

item.title: Localized websites and downloads - ID: 1369088
item.detail:
Hello,
I made some short signatures for your portable apps.
Edit Office documents on every PC or Laptop: Portable OpenOffice.org With your own preferences, templates, dictionaries. Without installation. Free. http://portableoo.sourceforge.net/
Surf the Web with your own browser on every PC, even in Internet Caf¨¦s: Portable Firefox With all your preferences, bookmarks, passwords, extensions. Without installation. Free. http://portablefirefox.sourceforge.net/
Chat with your own messenger on every PC, even in Internet Caf¨¦s: Portable Gaim With all your preferences, passwords, logs. Without installation. Free. http://portablegaim.sourceforge.net/
1) portablegaim.sourceforge.net should redirect to http://johnhaller.com/jh/useful_stuff/portable_gaim/ instead of http://johnhaller.com/jh/development/portable_apps/
2) There should be localized project pages and downloads, too.
I would love to translate them to german.
Keep up the good work, Ren¨¦po

item.title: Add Portable Registry Tool - ID: 1898155
item.detail:
It would be nice if there was a portable registry tool that could be used with the portable application suite. It would be nice if the registry tool was similar to Reg, but portable. http://sourceforge.net/projects/reg/
like the ability to do a search for keyword and delete all in one shot.

item.title: Recognise preinstalled applications - ID: 1959850
item.detail: For various reasons it is possible for someone to install potentially all the offered applications, which takes a large amount of time, and have customized them all as needed, before they needed or wanted to install the menu program. Because of this possibility the menu program should have the ability to find or be shown applications that have already been installed, then add them to the list.

item.title: SNES Emulator - ID: 1765614
item.detail: Would be very nice to have a Super Nintendo emulator (also know as Famicon if I'm no wrong) ^^

item.title: Add other programs - ID: 1777216
item.detail:
Would like the ability to add programs to the apps list. Basically I have some apps there are .jar or run from .bat files that I would like to add. It would also give the ability to launch the same program with different command line arguments.
Somewhat similar to: 1670190

item.title: Ability to add programs in sub folders - ID: 1670190
item.detail: I would like to be able to add a program to the menu that is in a sub folder. When I PortableApps\newprogram\subfloder\program.exe It will not show up on menu. I've copied the exe to just the newprogram folder and it shows up but will not run, it has to be in its specific folder to work. If you could also add support for batch files to show up on the menu that would be great too. Thanks for all the work you've done so far I love Portableapps.

This feature gives the opportunity to the user to see the programs that he has recently use and he can open it directly. If there are many programs install on the Portable Software/USB this feature will be very helpful for the user.
I attach the file use case for recent programs view.

item.title: ability to create sub-menus - ID: 1972684
item.detail: I would like to have sub-menus to group for instance the OpenOffice applications and the system tools. I use a lot of the provided applications so I have to scroll a lot. Sub-menus would make it easier.

item.title: FindProcDll and Latent Error - ID: 1598327
item.detail:
Hi, Dear Project Developer,
After reading the code of FindProcDLL, i found that it is considered DANGEROUS that we use "pop $R0" command to get the return value. Because FindProcDLL will write the return value DIRECTLY to $R0 instead of pushing the return value to stack.
This may cause problem when you leave some data in the stack.
A nice solution is to use a macro to wrap FindProcDLL::FindProc function.
; =====MACRO-BLOCK-START===== !macro FindProc _RETURN_VAR _PROC_NAME Push $R0 ; [STACK] << $R0 FindProcDLL::FindProc "${_PROC_NAME}" Exch $R0 ; [STACK] << [RETURN_VALUE] Pop ${_RETURN_VAR} ; ${_RETURN_VAR} = [RETURN_VALUE] !macroend !define FindProc "!insertmacro FindProc" ; =====MACRO-BLOCK-END=====
And use command:
; =====CODE-EXAMPLE-BLOCK-START===== ${FindProc} [RETURN_VALUE] [PROC_NAME] ;e.g. ${FindProc} $R0 "firefox.exe" ; =====CODE-EXAMPLE-BLOCK-END=====
Hope this is helpful!
Regards, _______________hobbyscripter

item.title: ability to update included applications - ID: 1964524
item.detail: This would be very nice if we could update applications installed before.

item.title: Automatic Update - ID: 2945973
item.detail: Automatic Update include installed sub program

item.title: Ability to Change Displayed App Name - ID: 1614096
item.detail: Since the displayed application name seems to come from the application itself, and there is no XML file or INI file to edit, there is no way to customize the names of apps on the PA menu. My suggestion is to provide an XML file that lists the default names, but that would allow updating; or a file that maps the default name to a custom name, so that if that app doesn't have an entry, it simply uses the default name.

item.title: Portable SSH Client - ID: 1370508
item.detail:
Dear Mr. Haller,
I greatly appreciate the effort you have gone to in creating the Portable Apps suite. I use both PortableFirefox and PortableFirezilla every day. One application I would personally like to see added to the suite is a portable SSH client such as PuTTY. PuTTY is both open source and portable, but saves all settings and configuration information locally. It would be tremendously helpful and time-saving to have all the settings save to a portable device. Once again, thank you for your contribution to the open source community!
Sincerely,
Joseph Sturtevant

item.detail:
Thise is a VERY cool project i like it wery much.
I like to see a Image Editor in thise to.
The problem for me is coming to a place where the dont have a image editor, only windows "paint" and that not always good enough.
I can see some people working on GIMP portable, but it hasent been realese yet. https://sourceforge.net/projects/portablegimp/ But when it do it could be add to or what? Or any other now a good portable Editor!

can we get a skinning feature? we could have black or blue!

item.title: Support for Abyss Web Server X1 - ID: 1948071
item.detail:
Hello,
I very much like your XAMPP launcher for portableapps.
However, I am using the free Abyss Web Server X1 (http://www.aprelium.com/abyssws/) because I have found it easier to install ASP and ASP.NET support on this web server. It also has a very neat control panel. I was pulling my hair out with XAMPP!
Therefore I would like to ask you clever developers if you would kindly develop an Abyss launcher for the portable apps menu. If you're too short of time, would you please then consider integrating support for Abyss in the XAMPP launcher.
Thank you for the XAMPP launcher and please do consider creating a small launcher for Abyss (just to start/stop Apache and MySQL).
Kind regards, Olivier

item.title: GUI Editing - ID: 1679551
item.detail: Is there any way that the end user would be able to change the color scheme for the app, in a way that is easy to figure out without having to rebuild the entire app?

item.title: Portable SeaMonkey - ID: 1486176
item.detail: I'm not sure if anyone else would be interested in a portable version of SeaMonkey, but I much prefer the suite to the individual programs from Mozilla. I would love to see a portable version, and have a SeaMonkey Suite installer as well as the Firefox\Thunderbird Suite installer (basically, have the Portable Apps Suite with SeaMonkey instead of FF\TB).

item.title: Ability to Hide Apps - ID: 1614094
item.detail: I have Portable Opera on my thumbdrive, and when I put that app's folder into the PortableApps folder, not only does Opera's application show up on the PA menu, but an app called GASR shows up as well. Since it's part of the Portable Opera folder, I can't remove it, so I'm stuck with it showing or I have to remove the menu item for Opera.

item.title: new program: Miro - ID: 2814302
item.detail: It would be great if you could bring a portable version of Miro HD Video Player http://www.getmiro.com/ which is an Open Source internet TV viewer

item.title: Icon - ID: 3576142
item.detail:
When you install Portable Apps to a thumb drive, it changes the thumbdrive icon to portable apps, it would be nice to have an option to remove it.
Love this so useful

item.title: Ability to lauch apps on startup - ID: 1681830
item.detail: Add the ability to have a program launch on startup of the PA menu.

item.title: Easier Uninstall - ID: 3406234
item.detail:
Just as you have added the ability to auto update, and to select new apps, can you add an option to the Manage Menu to uninstall apps. This form would be much like the add new from, but all the check-boxes would be checked, and unchecking them would uninstall. Of course the check-box operation could be reversed, only check the ones to be uninstalled.
This would make it easier for me to try out and then remove beta/testing versions. Right now, I have to remove the libreoffice test, which is older than the release version.
